title: November 17, 2010
content:
CONVERSATIONS WITH REMARKABLE MINDS A spontaneous conversation on compassion and happiness, and a spiritual commentary... <!--more--> on some of the critical issues facing us today.
Prof Robert Thurman holds the first endowed chair in Buddhist Studies in the West, the Jey Tsong Khapa Chair in Indo-Tibetan Buddhist Studies, Columbia University.
He is President of Tibet House US, dedicated to preserving Tibetan civilization, and President of the American Institute of Buddhist Studies.
He is a passionate advocate not only for the rights of Tibetans, but for human rights around the world.
“Why the Dalai Lama Matters: His Act of Truth as a Solution for China, Tibet and the World”
Commentaries: We should not be a nation of secrets; US scientists significantly more likely to publish fake research [16Nov10-esciencenews.com]; Jail the Bankers Or This Economy Will Never Fully Recover [17Nov10-alternet.
org]; who IS responsible?
Health Updates: garlic vs hypertension; B vitamins vs depression; vegan diet; S.
510 Anti-microbial chemicals not healthy for people or planet-and plain soap & water is more effective.
